Modeler HTP

Source: R/06_modeler.R
modeler_HTP.Rd

Modeler HTP

Usage

modeler_HTP(
  x,
  index = "GLI",
  plot_id = NULL,
  check_negative = TRUE,
  add_zero = TRUE,
  max_as_last = FALSE,
  method = c("subplex", "pracmanm", "anms"),
  return_method = FALSE,
  parameters = NULL,
  lower = -Inf,
  upper = Inf,
  initial_vals = NULL,
  fixed_params = NULL,
  fn = "fn_piwise",
  metric = "sse",
  n_points = 1000,
  max_time = NULL
)

Arguments

x

An object of class read_HTP, containing the results of the read_HTP() function.

index

A string specifying the trait to be modeled. Default is "GLI".

plot_id

An optional vector of plot IDs to filter the data. Default is NULL, meaning all plots are used.

check_negative

Logical. Convert negative values to zero. TRUE by default.

add_zero

TRUE or FALSE. Add zero to the time series.TRUE by default.

max_as_last

Logical. If TRUE, adds the maximum value after reaching the local maximum. Default is FALSE.

method

A vector of the methods to be used, each as a character string. See optimx package. c("subplex", "pracmanm", "anms") by default.

return_method

TRUE or FALSE. To return the method selected for the optimization in the table. FALSE by default.

parameters

A named vector specifying the initial values for the parameters to be optimized. c(t1 = 38.7, t2 = 62, t3 = 90, k = 0.32, beta = -0.01) by default which is the same for all the plots.

lower

Bounds on the variables for methods such as "L-BFGS-B" that can handle box (or bounds) constraints.

upper

Bounds on the variables for methods such as "L-BFGS-B" that can handle box (or bounds) constraints.

initial_vals

A data.frame with columns <plot, genotype, t1, t2, ... , and all the initial parameters>. Specific initial values per plot.

fixed_params

A data.frame with columns <plot, genotype, t1, t2, ... , and all the fixed parameters>.

fn

String character with the name of the function "fn_lin_pl_lin".

metric

A character string specifying the metric to minimize. Can be "sse", "mae", "mse" or "rmse". Default is "sse".

n_points

Number of time points to approximate the Area Under the Curve (AUC). 1000 by default.

max_time

Maximum time value for calculating the AUC. NULL by default takes the last time point.

Value

An object of class modeler_HTP, which is a list containing the following elements:

param

A data frame containing the optimized parameters and related information.

dt

A data frame with data used.

fn

The call used to calculate the AUC.

max_time

Maximum time value used for calculating the AUC.

metrics

Metrics and summary of the models.

execution

Execution time.

Examples

library(exploreHTP)
suppressMessages(library(dplyr))
data(dt_potato)
dt_potato <- dt_potato
results <- read_HTP(
  data = dt_potato,
  genotype = "Gen",
  time = "DAP",
  plot = "Plot",
  traits = c("Canopy", "GLI_2"),
  row = "Row",
  range = "Range"
)
mat <- modeler_HTP(
  x = results,
  index = "GLI_2",
  plot_id = c(195),
  parameters = c(t1 = 38.7, t2 = 62, t3 = 90, k = 0.32, beta = -0.01),
  fn = "fn_lin_pl_lin",
)
plot(mat, plot_id = c(195))

print(mat)
#> 
#> Call:
#> fn_lin_pl_lin(time, t1, t2, t3, k, beta)
#> 
#> Sum of Squares Error:
#>      Min.   1st Qu.    Median      Mean   3rd Qu.      Max. 
#> 1.024e-05 1.024e-05 1.024e-05 1.024e-05 1.024e-05 1.024e-05 
#> 
#> Optimization Results `head()`:
#>  plot genotype   t1   t2   t3     k  beta      sse  auc
#>   195 W16219-8 39.6 68.3 93.3 0.323 -0.01 1.02e-05 16.4
#> 
#> Metrics:
#>  Plots      Timing Convergence Iterations
#>      1 0.8532 secs        100% 896 (plot)
#> 
can <- modeler_HTP(
  x = results,
  index = "Canopy",
  plot_id = c(195),
  parameters = c(t1 = 45, t2 = 80, k = 0.9),
  fn = "fn_piwise",
  max_as_last = TRUE
)
plot(can, plot_id = c(195))

print(can)
#> 
#> Call:
#> fn_piwise(time, t1, t2, k)
#> 
#> Sum of Squares Error:
#>      Min.   1st Qu.    Median      Mean   3rd Qu.      Max. 
#> 1.877e-18 1.877e-18 1.877e-18 1.877e-18 1.877e-18 1.877e-18 
#> 
#> Optimization Results `head()`:
#>  plot genotype   t1 t2   k      sse  auc
#>   195 W16219-8 38.7 62 100 1.88e-18 5765
#> 
#> Metrics:
#>  Plots      Timing Convergence Iterations
#>      1 0.4747 secs        100% 349 (plot)
#>
